com.remotemonster.sdk

Class Remon

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.remotemonster.sdk.Remon

  • public class Remon
extends java.lang.Object
    The most important class for using the RemoteMonster API. Connect to the server through the Remon class, send the command, and close it. It is mainly through RemonObserver to receive messages from the server.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Remon

        public Remon(android.content.Context ctx,
             Config config)
      throws RemonException
        Remon constructor. Since there is no observer, it is necessary to call init method for Observer etc. after creation. Need to separate creation and Observer registration procedures
        Parameters:
        ctx - Android Context. Usually we pass Context of Activity. It is usually necessary to handle processing related to Media
        config - Various configuration information needed to create RemoteMonster.     
        Throws:
        RemonException

      • Remon

        public Remon(android.content.Context ctx,
             Config config,
             RemonObserver observer)
      throws RemonException
        A constructor that takes a Remon object by one call and connects to the RemoteMonster API to complete the authentication
        Parameters:
        ctx - Android Context. Usually, we pass the context of Activity. It is usually necessary to handle processing related to Media
        config - Various configuration information needed to create RemoteMonster.
        observer - Callback class for RemoteMonster API
        Throws:
        RemonException -

      • init

        public void init(RemonObserver observer)
        If you have created a Remon object without RemonObserver, you must run this init to register the Callback class RemonObserver.
        Parameters:
        observer - Callback class for RemoteMonster API     

      • searchChannels

        public void searchChannels(java.lang.String channelId)
        Searching for channels. The search results are returned by RemonObserver's onSearchChannels method.
        Parameters:
        channelId - The name of the room or channel. Searchable part of all.      

      • fetchCasts

        public void fetchCasts()

      • fetchCalls

        public void fetchCalls()

      • sendMessage

        public void sendMessage(java.lang.String msg)
        You can send a message of a certain character format to each other while connected to each other by communication. The other party receives the message from RemonObserver's onMessage. Broadly not used in broadcasting
        Parameters:
        msg - A textual message to send to the other party.   

      • sendMessage

        public void sendMessage(java.lang.String code,
                        java.lang.String msg)
        You can send a message of a certain character format to each other while connected to each other by communication. The other party receives the message from RemonObserver's onMessage. Broadly not used in broadcasting
        Parameters:
        code - Can specify the kind of message
        msg - A textual message to send to the other party.      

      • createRoom

        public void createRoom(java.lang.String name)
        Create channel for broadcasting function.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the broadcast channel     

      • joinRoom

        public void joinRoom(java.lang.String id)
        Connect to broadcast channel and receive in viewonly mode
        Parameters:
        id - Room id value of broadcasting. Not name      

      • connectChannel

        public void connectChannel(java.lang.String channelId)
        If you enter a channel (room) already opened or if there is no room already opened, open the room with the name of the room you entered. When you enter the opened room, the onConnectChannel of the RemonObserver is called. When the new room is opened because there is no room opened, the onCreateChannel method is called.
        Parameters:
        channelId - The name of the room to enter or open.

        public boolean showLocalvideo()

      • softClose

        public void softClose()
        If you are in a situation where you need to terminate the communication and need a new communication again, running the softClose command instead of close is also helpful for faster connections.

      • close

        public void close()
        Remon Releases all resources owned by the object. If you do not need to re-communicate, you must execute this command, and if you are going to connect with someone again, you can run softClose command
